get_reg

  • get_reg(reg: RegNum): u32
    • Defined in sys.ts:58

    Get host communication register

    remark

    If reg is not a valid register number, execution of the program is aborted

    internal

    Parameters

    • reg: RegNum

      number of register

    Returns u32

set_reg

  • set_reg(reg: RegNum, val: u32): void
    • Defined in sys.ts:38

    Sets host communication register to value val

    remark

    If reg is not a valid register number, execution of the program is aborted

    internal

    Parameters

    • reg: RegNum

      number of register to set

    • val: u32

      value to set to the register

    Returns void

    • Defined in sys.ts:86

    Checks if current executing kernel supports given version of feature

    Parameters

    • feature: Feature

      Feature to check

    • Default value version: u32 = 1

      Version of feature

    Returns usize

    version if supported, 0 if unsupported

get_mouse_position

  • get_mouse_position(): Vec2d | null
    • Defined in sys.ts:266

    Get position of the mouse cursor relative to the top-left corner of the screen.

    Returns Vec2d | null

    2D vector with the position of the mouse cursor or null if mouse not above the canvas

query_text_render

  • query_text_render(id: usize, dst: usize): JobStatus
    • Defined in sys.ts:240

    Query status of scheduled text rendering job identified by id

    if JobStatus == Complete then save result to buffer pointed to by dst

    Parameters

    • id: usize

      job id

    • dst: usize

      pointer to the destination

    Returns JobStatus

    Status of the job identified by id

    • Defined in sys.ts:215

    Request rendering of text from the environment styled by the font style string, to buffer of dimensions

    Parameters

    • txt: string

      text

    • font_str: string

      font style string, see canvas font field

    • width: u32

      dimensions

    • height: u32

      dimension

    Returns usize

timer

  • timer(id: u32): usize
    • Defined in sys.ts:194

    Used to track time between two operations

    Stores current time and returns difference in milliseconds between current time and last call to timer with this id

    Parameters

    • id: u32

      Timer ID

    Returns usize

    Difference in milliseconds or 0 if timer not set

yield_control

  • yield_control(controlCode?: YieldControlCode): void
    • Defined in sys.ts:125

    Releases ownership of current thread to the kernel for background task processing.

    !!!BEWARE!!! execution of current program is aborted and the stack is reset

    Parameters

    • Default value controlCode: YieldControlCode = YIELD_CONTROL_CODES.RESUME

      controls yield behaviour

    Returns void

    Never returns
